page.title: 07Mortimer Teacher's Memories
page.content: Childrens accounts of talk (5-6yrs):- "She told us about the house called Saddlers (the oldest house in the village). On one side of the house her Grandpa made saddles for horses, but on the other side was a small sweet shop and she went to get her sweets there." "The school was much smaller and it only had 30 children in one large room - that is the amount we've got in one class." "There was a pumping station and a water tower and two cobblers and four blacksmiths and when she was a girl she painted the horse's hooves with oil if it was quiet." "There were two cycle shops and the vicar was the first one in the village to have a car." "There were five little sweet shops that had nice sweets in them."
